segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
“Sir, they speak of someone who is ‘accomplished regarding the faculties’.

segments.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, indriyasampanno hotī”ti?
segments.en: How is someone accomplished regarding the faculties defined?”

segments.pli: “Idha, bhikkhu, bhikkhu saddhindriyaṃ bhāveti upasamagāmiṃ sambodhagāmiṃ, vīriyindriyaṃ bhāveti upasamagāmiṃ sambodhagāmiṃ, satindriyaṃ bhāveti upasamagāmiṃ sambodhagāmiṃ, samādhindriyaṃ bhāveti upasamagāmiṃ sambodhagāmiṃ, paññindriyaṃ bhāveti upasamagāmiṃ sambodhagāmiṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicant, it’s when a mendicant develops the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom that lead to peace and awakening.

segments.pli: Ettāvatā kho, bhikkhu, bhikkhu indriyasampanno hotī”ti.
segments.en: This is how someone who is accomplished regarding the faculties is defined.”

suttaplex.blurb: Someone who develops the faculties is said to be equipped with faculties.
